h2.title: What is AVIF?
h2.description: AVIF (AV1 Image File Format) is a modern image format based on the AV1 video codec. It provides excellent compression efficiency, often resulting in 50% smaller file sizes compared to JPEG or PNG, while maintaining high visual quality. However, AVIF is not yet universally supported by all browsers and software.

h2.title: What is PNG?
h2.description: PNG (Portable Network Graphics) is a widely supported raster image format known for its lossless compression and perfect transparency support. PNG is ideal for graphics, icons, and images that require crisp details and transparency across all platforms.

h2.title: Use Cases: When to Convert AVIF to PNG
h2.description:
• Web Compatibility: Ensure your images are viewable on browsers or devices that don’t support AVIF.
  • Design Workflows: PNG integrates seamlessly with design and editing software.
  • Logo & Icons: PNG is the standard for transparent images used in branding.
  • File Sharing: Send images to colleagues or clients who may not support AVIF.
  • Archiving: Store high-quality images in a universally accessible format.
